characters: ON THE UNDERSIDE OF THE CAR
CHARLIE EYES A CASE WITH A BATTLE AXE
WE HOLD ON THEIR REFLECTION IN THE WINDOW
THEY SWERVE OUT THE SHADOW HILLS GATES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving through a tract development. The houses are like Mexican food -- the basic elements are all the same, just mixed differently. A gloomy night, no moon. And a slightly ominous pattern emerges... Green, thriving lawns and meticulously tended homes abut brown yards and porches littered with old newspapers and pizza joint flyers. Each third or fourth house is FOR SALE or, worse, seeming abandoned. This area is in danger of becoming a ghost tow A deep, commanding voice pierces the silence:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Defy reason. Defy everything you know. Now we move in on one of the homes. Not the nicest on the block, but inhabited. Lights on in the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the house. A middle-class family lives here. The living room is empty, but the TV's on.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TELEVISION
dialogues.text: A commercial for PETER VINCENT. A Las Vegas institution, he's a magician whose show is all Gothic, horror-movie imagery. Peter's wiry, hot -- a rock and roll bad boy. He's cuttin girl up with a chain saw. And grinning like a mad man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Vincent's "FRIGHT NIGHT." The family DOG is up on the coffee table eating what's le of a fast food burger and fries, still in the box.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something's moving in the dark.
Also on the table -- a role-playing game in progress. "Magic, the Gathering"... Elves and Wizards.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only at The Hard Rock. Nightly Wednesday Through Sunday. Now we hear what at first sounds like a MUFFLED ARGUMENT coming from another room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off her!! More voices yelling, something being thrown. An ugly domestic scene. We creep down a dark hall toward a cracked door, light se through the opening -- it SLAMS OPEN and ADAM, 17, crashe toward us. He's nice-looking, a little nerdy -- and he's in a blind terror. We get a glimpse of the horrible scene behind the door. A teen girl's room -- the sound of flesh ripping. We see a pale arm on the ground, shaking violently, as if something is tearing and tugging at the body attached to We bolt away with ADAM, who we now see is blood splattere as he races UPSTAIRS. A PHONE CRADLE is ripped out of the wall, which Adam nearly falls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM RACES INTO HIS PARENTS' ROOM. Another horrible glimp - his mother's body splayed across her frilly bed. Blood on pale pink sheets. ADAM goes to his FATHER'S SIDE OF THE BED and now we see Adam's father's body. His father was reaching for A GUN h hidden under the bed. ADAM gets down under the bed, desperately reaches for the gun. It's just beyond his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come on... He gets it. But the GUN HAS A GUN LOCK. Adam has to dig i his dead father's pockets for his keys. Adam starts to cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! He finds them, struggles to unlock the gun with shaking hands. THE BED IS TURNED OVER in one violent throw. Adam is exposed. We see only a hint of the creature that looms ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brutally strong, veins dark and visible under the skin... Human but not quite. Adam reacts in horror. He knows he's dead. HE's RIPPED OUT OF FRAME as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: DISC JOCKEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: .we're looking at a nice day here in Clark County, hitting a season low of only 89 degrees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC starts under the DISC JOCKEY as we LOOK DOWN FROM H ABOVE at the SAME suburban neighborhood as before. In the daylight it seems nice. Charming, even. Pocket parks decorate almost every corner and kids ride b in the street. Mothers unload groceries. Neighbors chat.

dialogues.speaker: DISC JOCKEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: .so get out there and enjoy this beautiful Wednesday, people. We SWOOP CLOSER and find that RADIO comes from a passing MINIVAN with those cutesy stick figure family decals on t rear window. The FOR SALE SIGNS and brown lawns don't seem nearly so foreboding now. We SWOOP UP AGAIN and see beyond Shadow Hills, past the W that encompasses it -- and become aware for the first tim that the community is SURROUNDED BY FLAT, ARID DESERT. In the distance, we can just make out the glow of Las Veg proper. It looks like a distant fantasy, a land-locked Pleasure Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels of a DIRT BIKE as it zooms down the street. WIDEN to see CHARLIE BREWSTER, who is PUSHING the bike as fast as he can. It STARTS, sputters -- then craps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bike/pissed) You want me to take you apart, huh? Charlie's 17 and has the slightly awkward feel of someone just recently came into his body and good looks. He's a wry, thoughtful kid who's enjoying -- but not quit trusting -- a sudden surge in popularity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still talking to bike) I will. I'll sell you for parts. Don't think I won't-- Charlie stops, embarrassed. DORIS -- a neighbor -- watche him talk to his bike. Paused as she hauls her trash cans the curb. She's super pretty in a wholesome way -- except for her ridiculous body. Stripper city. She nods to the bike, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing doing, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing's got no ambition. (re: trash cans) Can I -- uh, give you a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. Thanks. She walks away -- her sweatpants have the word "LUCKY" ac the butt. He watches her go appreciatively. Doesn't notic his mom, JANE, struggling to pull their own cans to the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leer at the neighbors, kid. Jane, 40's, attractive and frazzled, wears a REAL ESTATE brokers blazer. Charlie wheels his bike back to the curb.
He and his mom have had an affectionate, teasing relation which has only recently started to have more edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one who put a word on her butt. I'm just reading it. Jane eyes a LARGE DUMPSTER FULL OF CONCRETE that sits in front of their NEXT DOOR NEIGHBOR'S YARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he ever going to move that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get over it, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attitude. (observes him/then) You've been tense or something. School?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School's great, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Hasn't dumped me yet. He says this like he's surprised. Jane nods. Getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll teach you to get so tall and handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting what you want is stressful. Especially when you're not used to it. More to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you reading those books again? The Power of Whatever the Hell? She laughs. He glances at the DUMPSTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not working. You're still flipping out about a big box.
Now Jane moves to the open garage and starts loading OPEN HOUSE SIGNS into her trunk. Charlie stands there. She shoots him a look -- then he helps her load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an eyesore. I'm trying to convince people to move in, not join the legions leaving town--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say "mortgage crisis" again I'm getting a new mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy moves in and puts a giant trash can in his yard! When the Perry's lived there-- Charlie has heard this before. It's a common refrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Perry's were the greatest neighbors ever. But they moved. I thought you were happy their place finally sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back on the neighbor) He's not digging a pool. Where do you think all that concrete's coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're spying on the guy now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's thirteen feet from our house. That's not spying, that's observing. A BEETLE CONVERTIBLE pulls up. AMY drives and her two hot friends, CARA and BEE, sit in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Brewster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi honey. Hi girls. ANY, 16, is a stunner. And she's as cool as she is beauti -- the girl every other guy in school would die to be wit
But Charlie is. And he can't believe his luck. Which puts him off his game. She makes him feel like he's always playing catch up. Charlie moves toward the VW. Jane calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey -- Ed called. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of making excuses, Charlie. If you don't want to talk to him, would you please tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda defeats the purpose. He gets to AMY and the girls. Amy glances at the dirt bik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still can't get the bike started, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. No faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't need a ride. Amy calls his bluff and starts to drive off. Charlie grab his backpack and RACES after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hey, stop-- She laughs, stops the car. Charlie tries to jump in and s drives again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Hey!-- Charlie runs and finally dives into the back headfirst. T girls are laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching them drive off, gone in a cloud of teen spirit.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. AMY'S CAR
dialogues.text: The Beetle zips through a commercial strip. More suburban paradise. Charlie's in the front seat now. Amy drives, one hand on wheel. Casually drops one on Charlie's leg. Charlie tries to act casual, but he's stoked and... amazed. Cara half-sleeps in the back while BEE leans forward, fli and eyes Charlie's COLORFUL PUMA SNEAKERS. Charlie's a sneakerhead, a serious collector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a man to wear purple, Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck likes it when I call him Chuck, right Chuck? Intimidated by these girls, he tries to form a witty reto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's -- they're not -- that's, like, puce? That's a macho puce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stop someplace? I'm severely under-caffeinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores her/to Bee) Did you see the poster for the formal? The theme is "Hope"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. They asked me to be on the committee again but I was like -- hope is completely 2008. Grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you suggest "Despair?" Nobody would see that coming. Or -- global warming? Everybody has to wear tin foil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs/to Charlie) Did you go last year? We basically did the whole thing, Bee and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I, ah, was in training that week. This big triatha--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Chuck was still under his rock. We're so glad you crawled out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caffeine!? Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have Econ first period. Amy takes her hand off his leg. Charlie notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charrrliiieeeee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Yeah. It's no big deal. Amy PULLS into a coffee place. Parks. The girls climb out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jesus. Amy catches Charlie looking at his watch, fidgeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to flunk for missing Econ, Brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain? I -- what? No, I'm-- But she's already walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes. He watches her move off, anxious and smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie arrives with Amy, Cara and Bee -- all the girls n sport coffee drinks. Charlie has one too, with whipped cr and the works.
Kids stream into a nice, modern-looking high school. Amy takes Charlie's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On time. You stress too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were doing your worried thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was? I have a -- what's my--

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies! A couple of handsome jock-type guys, MARK and BEN, roll u along side Charlie and the girls. They draw looks from ot students as they move through the courtyard. The cool kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doods. Looking massive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlie/re: drink) Seriously? A Mochachino? You can't ride with the girls anymore. You let them brush your hair, My Pretty Pony? Mark grabs the cup away from him. Starts drinking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes his arm) Chuck's secure, aren't you? We see that Ben is also wearing PUMA's. Different design. It's a thing. Charlie shows his off -- he's secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have track after school, maybe we can hook up later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hey. Come here. (pulls her aside/awkward) You know, the formal. Don't think I wasn't going to ask you, because I thought it was an obvious go. Together. Hope, puppies, kittens, the whole deal. You and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Please. Nobody goes to the dance senior year. She smiles, moves off. He watches her, lets out a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I knew that. MARK and BEN enjoy the view as the girls move off. Wow. Mark, incredulous, says to Charlie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find a frickin' Genie lamp man? Make a sacrifice to the hot ass Gods? How do you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game, my friend. Rock solid. Charlie moves off. And even though he's playing it off, w see that Mark's hit a nerve. This hot girlfriend thing is bitch. Mark calls after him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even have a car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Charlie's in Econ class. Seated in a back row near MARK and BEN. A number of seats in class are EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben Wegner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Noris? Nothing. Teacher looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam? (marks chart/then) Courtney Heuer? A girl raises her hand. Charlie, bored, idly checks out the class. Stops when he sees a tweaked-looking kid, ED, staring at him. EVIL ED is a slight, faintly punk-looking kid who's been picked on by bullies his whole life. He's hyper-intelligent, hyper-critical and... just hyper. his binder is covered with COMIC BOOK STICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Straley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Ed sees that he's caught Charlie's eye. Nods significantl at him. Like -- "you know and I know..." Charlie looks away. As if he didn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, Mark and Ben move down the hall. Mark shows Char a picture on his phone. A woman posing seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Granada. Geometry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap. Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hard up, man. Equations don't keep you warm at night. They stop, see EVIL ED approaching. This amuses Mark and Ben. But Charlie's uncomfortable -- wants to bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think "it's" going to talk to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's" going to talk to Brewster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to get the message? We don't know you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. Or did. Before the summer and his Jock Lobotomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ed/uncomfortable) What's the deal, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone. Ed stares Charlie down. A beat. Ben and Mark bust out laughing. Mark looks at Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the two of you. That's sweet. He can school you in the ways of geek-douchery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important. "Brewster." The way Ed says his name is enough to propel Charlie into action. He grabs Ed and pulls him aside. Mark and Ben wat with interest -- out of earshot. Ed's tone is dire, serious as a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's missing. Charlie's looking around, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, he's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep trying him -- nothing. No texts, no phone. And he's not the only one who's gone. You heard roll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So kids aren't coming to school. What do you want me to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me at his house after school. We'll check around. See what's up, if he's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't after school. I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you get what I'm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, do we have to do this here? Ed can't believe it. Charlie's totally blowing him off. H starts to lose it, raises his voice--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, am I not even suppose to speak to you now?--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it down. Don't spaz--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so horrible! Crossing the streams! Will High School as we know it cease to exist?! Ed glances at Mark and Ben, who still watch from a distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to tell your pals how well we know each other? The Lego contests, the Farscape conventions,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or how your first sexual experience was with an Electra figurine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then be my backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Adam's after school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be late. Moves off. Charlie sees the guys watching him. A beat. He shrugs like "I have no idea what that was about..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has set behind the mountains. It's gloomy gray ou right before dark. Charlie and AMY park, climb out of her car with drinks fr PLANET SMOOTHIE in hand. She's still in her track and fie clothes. Looks tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I want? For dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're eating right now, you know. As you speak. You literally just forced me to get you a smoothie so large they named a planet after it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran six miles. What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- watched you. But not in a creepy way. Charlie winces a little. It sounds creepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't judge. You don't want me to burn my big ole' booty off, do you? Charlie, on impulse, stops her -- kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you're just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. A sweet moment. These two have a definite thing. It's rea They're about to kiss again when JANE'S GIRLISH LAUGH sto them. They both turn and REACT AS THEY SEE... A MUSCLED MALE, SQUATTING AND HUNCHED-OVER -- clad only i white wife-beater and jeans. We can't make out his face. Jane stands over him, laughing at something he's said as FIXES their sprinkler. PUSH IN as the guy looks up. This is JERRY. 30's. Handsom to the point of devastating. An all-American Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at Mom. She'sГўВЂВ”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right. If he followed her home, you have to let her keep him. Amy laughs -- almost skips toward them, milking the momen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED paces anxiously in front of ADAM'S HOUSE. He has a duf bag over his shoulder. Keeps checking his phone. He finally dials in a number. Talks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. I'm in front of Adam's. Remember the videos we all made back when? You and me and Adam, bro? In tights. Want your pals to get a load of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Charlie approach Jane and Jerry. They overhear--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .so not a pool, what's the work you're doing?
Jerry has an easy-going way about him. An inviting charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foundation problems. I had to rip up half the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These houses were built practically overnight. I'm never surprised when they come apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Just needed a new stem. Jane sees Charlie and Amy approaching. And gaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, this is my son Charlie. And his -- do we say girlfriend now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. I mean -- only if she's-- Amy's amused at Charlie's squirming, finally saves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes Jerry's hand) Hi. I'm Amy. He can't help but give Amy an appreciative once-over. She enjoys it, but pulls away and moves closer to Charlie. Charlie notices the exchange -- the way this dude oozes manliness. Doesn't like it one bit. He shakes Jerry's han a little too firmly. Lowers his voice a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's our new neighbor. The Perry place. He's "handy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Charlie, smiles) No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the mess, man. I was just telling your mom I'll have the dumpster gone next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't bother me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry does night construction on the strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Charlie's shoes) You play ball? I'm always looking for a pick up game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now and then, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more of a collector thing. The shoes. He's obsessed. (to Jerry/"those teens") They sleep on sidewalks to get them. Charlie looks at Jane, thanks for embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- they're bold. I like them. Jerry looks back at Jane. A little flirtatious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I'd ask you guys inside, but it's a mess. I've been meaning to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be neighborly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink, something. It hangs there, waiting for an invitation. Jane just smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. And thank you so much. For the help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least I could do. Jane, Amy and Charlie walk toward the house. Jerry moves off. Amy looks at Jane, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you blow him off? Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy that good-looking, still single? Bad bet. He's a player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. Breaking it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough man trouble. I'm not getting suckered again. Amy and Charlie meet eyes. That was loaded. Jane notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to me. Jaded old

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's PHONE buzzes. He checks it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: A VIDEO CLIP from ED. TITLED "KID COMEBACK and SUPER SQUI It shows Charlie, Ed and Adam when they were younger, prancing around in homemade costumes and, indeed, tights. The text message says "10 MINUTES -- OR THIS IS GOING WID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed/to Amy) Wow. Okay. I gotta go. Sorry. Call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have dinner on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. I'll eat later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!
But Charlie's already off and running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie approaches, sees ED pacing in front of the house. He's flipping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said after school, chill out! Ed is already lugging his big duffle to Adam's front door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right after! It's dusk, dude, you know what that means!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the sun's gone down. What's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over him, Ed knocks loudly. Rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Anybody home? A long pause. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here. Let's go-- But Ed's already heading around the house with the duffle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed wriggles in through the DOG DOOR. He turns, lets Charl in. Charlie looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nuts. It's the SAME HOUSE we saw in the opening, but completely righted. TV is off, the walls are clean. Furniture in it' proper place. It's perfect. They move into the house. Ed is wired, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Ed and Charlie here! (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Charlie follows him in. Resigned and placating. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Fine. Ed opens his duffle bag. Inside are CROSSES, STAKES, HOLY WATER, even a small AX. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this. Ed hands Charlie a STAKE. Charlie eyes it, incredulous. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding me. Ed stops. This is it. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to tell you this but that guy, your neighbor. (DEAD SERIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a vampire. One of the undead. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My neighbor. Next door. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just met him. Jerry. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry. A beat. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a terrible vampire name. "Jerry." Seriously-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't name him, man, I'm just reporting the facts! Ed moves UP THE STAIRS. Charlie reluctantly follows. It's darker up here. Lights off.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, this is a gag -- right? Ed's barely listening -- cautious. Every shadow is potent death. Total shmuck bait... ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Anybody here? They pass the empty MASTER BEDROOM -- where we saw ADAM's parents slaughtered. Now its clean and empty. Then Ed turns into ADAM's room. It's full of geekery. Action figures, the like. Charlie sticks behind him. The guys don't register the mostly obscured form of SOMEB HIDING BEHIND the door. A LARGE MALE figure. Ed catches sight of the guy, and SPINS toward it, freaked Charlie also reacts, scared. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back, demon! Ed thrusts his cross forward which knocks the door open, toppling A MOVIE CHARACTER STANDEE. A beat. Then Ed lets out a slightly manic laugh. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! I killed that sucker dead! CHARLIE (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not here, okay? They left town. His dad was a deadbeat-- Ed pulls a MAP out of his pocket. It has lots of red and black DOTS marked on it. He thrusts it at Charlie. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, see, it's not just them. It started -- there was this thing on Channel 13, a lady escaped an attacker who tried to bite her. Ed points to the RED DOTS on his chart. They form a loose circle around CHARLIE'S house. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and me, we graphed the attack, the disappearances. Whole families, gone. (MORE)     23 ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's you guys at the center, see? His windows are totally BLACKED OUT-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ton of houses like that. People work nights on the strip-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But every window? No. I've been watching him. It all fits-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Jerry's a Dracula. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Dracula is a specific vampire. I'M SAYING-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're saying! I'm mocking you. You've been reading too much Twilight-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiction, okay? This is real. A real monster. And he's not brooding. Or lovesick. Or noble. He's the fucking shark from JAWS. He feeds, he kills, and he doesn't move on until everyone around him is dead. (MOST EMPHATIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that book SUCKS. Charlie can't help but pause. Ed's conviction is so real. But he shakes it off. CHARLIE COME ON-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your neighbors, the Perrys? He moved into their house. Haven't seen them around, have you? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in San Diego like a month ago! ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exception, proves the rule. You haven't asked him in, have you? He can't get in without an invitation.     24 CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom? Lonely divorcee... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on drugs. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Well, yeah... I thought you'd take my word, but I have evidence at home. Hard evidence. Charlie stops fighting it and humors him. Ed's lost it. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. ED (INTENSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stake him in his nest. You and me. Not now, it's dark. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Cause he's nocturnal. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for -- okay -- for a minute pretend you're not a douche now-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Ed, this stuff, it was fun when we were eight-- ED SIXTEEN-- CHARLIE (LOSING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever! I grew up, okay? You don't want to, fine. But don't get an attitude because I'd rather have a life than make shit up! Ed stops. Stung. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Got it. You're soooo cool "Brewster." Go ahead, join the Clark High early-peakers. This is the pinnacle for them. And that includes your girl--
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undeniably doable, but we used to make fun of her and her pals, remember? They're bimbos-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Charlie barely refrains from hitting Ed. Instead he shove him away. Ed stumbles. Falls. He looks up at Charlie, genuinely hurt and desperate. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's gone -- you act like it has nothing to do with you. (THEN/PAINED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were inseparable, man. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And you know when I got popular? The minute I stopped hanging out with you. Charlie takes off. Ed watches him go. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while later. It's REALLY DARK now. Ed, gripping his duffle bag nervously, skates down a residential street. Houses here are spaced far apart and lights in many of them are off. Ed is anxious, watchful. He knows it's not safe. Every da corner is potentially the end of him. A few cars pass. Something moves behind him. Footsteps GAINING. Ed abandons his skateboard and BOLTS. A hand SLAMS on his shoulder, spins him around. IT's MARK Charlie's pal from school. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crossed my yard. Tracked your nerdjuice all over it.
ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sorry-- MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom works hard on that shit, MORON--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed glances around nervously, it's dark and anything... el could be out there. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just hit me? I don't have time for the build up. (he steels himself) Go. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously? ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, man! Just do it! Fine. Mark winds up and SWINGS -- a brutal blow. Ed DUCKS and runs. Mark's immediately on his heels. The guys dodge and dart through the neighborhood. But Ed experience in the art of losing bullies and he manages to shake Mark for a moment. Ed scrambles over a wooden fence, but his DUFFLE BAG GETS CAUGHT ON TOP. Most of his vamp hunting stuff SPILLS over the OTHER SIDE OF THE FENCE. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap. Crap! There's not time to get the stuff. He can hear Mark approaching in the dark. He drops into a neighbor's backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED spins and slams right into MARK -- no, it's JERRY. Ed falls back and scrambles away, terrified. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away! I'm armed mother fucker! Jerry moves after Ed, angry but controlled. More like a m than a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark pulls up on the other side of the wood fence. Sees E VAMP HUNTING STUFF on the ground, laughs. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. A beat, Mark glances at the high fence. Decides he's done He kicks some of Ed's stuff as he moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed trips over kid's toys and bikes as he runs to the hous There's a porch light on over the back door. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pounding on door) Hey! Let me in! Please! But there's no answer. Ed is desperate, Sees Jerry closin in, walking across the backyard. Ed takes a ROCK and smashes the window over the kitchen s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed falls through the window into the kitchen. Looks out. JERRY stalks toward him. All hulking menace. But Ed's safe now. Calls out-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it sucker! No invite! BAM! Jerry kicks in the kitchen door. Ed, terrified, fall back. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoned. I thought you did your homework. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what? JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been watching me. I've been watching you. Seems fair. Ed BOLTS into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he races through the empty rooms he pulls a stake from pocket. We see he's wearing a cross around his neck on a long chain. JERRY's following, but barely breaking a sweat. Ed sees A SLIDING GLASS DOOR to the back. He fumbles with the lock, gets it open and runs into the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed races for the back gate-- AND SUDDENLY JERKS TO A STOP. Jerry has him by the back of the CROSS he's wearing. Ed's lifted WAY off his feet by the CHAIN, until he's cho on it, the cross directly under his neck. JERRY looks away as he SNAPS the chain off Ed and HURLS t cross into the neighbor's POOL. Ed falls to the ground, watches the cross sink in despair Jerry's standing over him. Smiles a little. We get just a flash -- he suddenly has MORE TEETH, sharper, in rows. It chilling. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit off more than you can chew. Shaking, terrified, Ed brandishes the STAKE. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see, man. I know my shit. But Jerry doesn't appear to be afraid. He looks at Ed wit actual sympathy. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Who's going to believe you? You see the truth, but what good is it when you're alone? Ed's shaken -- but still grips the stake. Holding on. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play that stuff. That mind crap. Come on -- try me. Try me!
JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you're glad you're different. But how can you be in a place like this? These people... Even your best friend. You're nothing to him now. Ed's listening despite himself, hurting now. Jerry moves step in. Ed raises his stake again -- but with slightly l conviction. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be over. I can make all that pain go away. Ed's fighting tears. Life as he knows it is gone. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were born for this and you know it. Your "life", what you had? That's the illusion. (off Ed's silence) I can take you somewhere great. Somewhere you'll belong. Ed takes this in. His eyes clear a bit. Is it...hope? JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gift. And Jerry moves closer, blocking our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new day. Sunny and hot. A truck moves the DUMPSTER from Jerry's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the kitchen window, Jane watches the DUMPSTER dri away. She's pleased, a little surprised. Says to herself.
JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good on his word. A knock at the door. It's Amy. She lets herself in. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Charlie? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try. My voice seems to be on some frequency he can't hear. AMY

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming! Amy looks at Jane, who shakes her head. Amy moves to the island. Grins a little. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to Hot Neighbor again? You should facebook him. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Temptress. I'm resolved. Charlie runs down. Wet from the shower, discombobulated. pecks Amy, grabs food off a plate. He's out of sorts. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oversleep? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't. (off her look) Weird dreams. Charlie gives Jane a quick peck and follows Amy out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Charlie head to the car. Charlie turns -- looks b at JERRY'S HOUSE. The blacked out windows... AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Charlie snaps out of it. It's crazy to even entertain Ed' theories.     31 CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. That guy was such a tool. AMY (HUMORING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally. Poser. She gets in the car. Smiles a little. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's in class. He's restless, agitated. On his pad, absently draws VAMPIRE images, blood... TEACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally Cabella? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. TEACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Lee? Nothing. Charlie looks up. TEACHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward Lee? Charlie looks around. No Ed. And just like he said -- qui a few other kids are missing. Charlie takes this in, look around. ABOVE CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEATS ALL AROUND HIM ARE EMPTY. This time it makes an impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, Mark, Ben and the rest of the guys get ready for practice. Mark's in the middle of a story, but Charlie is distracted -- barely listening. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .she's wearing a jumpsuit, dude. Like -- one zip and POP! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.     32 MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with you? Dreaming about your little boyfriend? Charlie takes this in, worried. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see him around today? Ed? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't track "it's" whereabouts. What did he want, anyway? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Homework stuff. But Charlie's clearly distracted. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I have to go. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? You're ditching? I'll bail with you. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'm -- I don't feel so well. He takes off. Ben and Mark watch him, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another suburban development. Rows and rows of red tile roofs, houses stacked right on top of one another... Charlie rings the bell of a modest place. Not as big as where Charlie and Jane live. But nice, well-tended for. ED's mom, VICTORIA, answers. She's surprised to see him. VICTORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Hi Mrs. Lee. Victoria breaks into a wide smile. VICTORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God you're a sight for sore eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria pulls Charlie in and hugs him, happy. Calls out- VICTORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick! Charlie's here! (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. So handsome! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I -- you don't have to-- Now RICK, Ed's dad comes into the room. Shakes his hand. RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed said you'd sprouted. And you're, the-- Rick awkwardly gestures around his face. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleared up. Yes sir-- VICTORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed will be so sorry he missed you, But -- you should both be in school now, shouldn't you? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here? Did you see him today? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's usually up and out early. Everything okay? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sure. We're working on a class project. I guess we crossed paths. VICTORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're doing that. Ed, he'd be mad that I said so, but he talks about you all the time. This lands hard on Charlie. How remiss he's been. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's... He's great. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be okay if I went upstairs? Ed has a book we need.
VICTORIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Make yourself at home. Charlie goes upstairs. Victoria makes a face at Rick -- "that's good!" They're both pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's room is a shrine to comic books, horror and fantasy movies. There's an art table where Ed has been working on some illustrations for a noir-style graphic novel. Charlie sto and looks at them. They're fantastic. He looks at the photos on the wall -- including a few pictures of Ed, Charlie and Adam when they were friends.

dialogues.speaker: A PHOTO
dialogues.text: Charlie and Ed, arms around each other. Charlie is shorte and thinner -- with really bad acne. Not cute. WAY not. ON CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. Best not to dwell. He turns and sees-- PETER VINCENT'S "FRIGHT NIGHT" POSTER on a wall. Charlie takes it in, laughs a little. Then Charlie examines a WHOLE WALL devoted to Ed's investigation of Jerry. Maps, news reports, vampire lore printed off the internet, books, etc. If you didn't know the difference, you'd say it's just mo of Ed's fictional world. Charlie stares at it all for a beat. Then shakes his head It's all a fantasy -- nothing more. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. He starts to take off. But sees that Ed's computer is on and one file stands out. "THE JERRY DIARIES." Charlie gives in to his curiosity -- clicks it open -- fi a bunch of Quicktime files. He opens one. Stops.

As BLURRY short clips play: Jerry's truck, in motion but it looks like NOBODY'S DRIVI IT. DORIS the neighbor chatting on Jerry's lawn -- with nobod Over and over, it's appears that JERRY DOESN'T SHOW UP on video. OFF CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking this in. Chilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark as Charlie comes home. He looks warily at Jerry house as he searches for his keys. BAM -- he walks right into JERRY. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guy. Charlie tries to maintain his cool. What if Jerry is what thought? Impossible, but... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Guy. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could really do me a solid. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What kind. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a girl on her way over for a beer, and I'm totally out of beer. They're at Charlie's back door, the one that leads to the kitchen. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bummer. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set me up, I'll pay you back two times. A sixer for your mom, and one for you. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, sure.
Jerry watches Charlie as he unlocks the door. This is when Charlie should invite him in. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see what Mom's got. She's kind of a "light domestic".. .mom. Charlie steps inside. Pointedly DOESN'T ask Jerry to ente Charlie intentionally leaves the door open, moves to the refrigerator. But keeps his eyes on Jerry. If he steps in uninvited, Ed's theory is blown. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice kitchen. Same floor plan as my place, huh? Jerry leans against the door jamb -- BUT DOES NOT CROSS T THRESHOLD. Charlie observes this. Holy shit. Charlie and Jerry MEET EYES. Then a cold smile creeps ove Jerry's face. Charlie fumbles, lets one of the wet beers slide from his hand -- it hits the ground, explodes. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with that? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No. Thanks. I'll get it. Jerry takes in Charlie's frantic refusal. Now he's darkly certain. He's been made. Charlie tosses the broken bottle into the sink. Moves to doorway with the remaining beers. Charlie hands them over the threshold. But doesn't cross. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. Uh...party down. Jerry watches him, intense. His tone shifts -- cocky and intimidating. A threat disguised as "guy talk." JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This girl tonight -- she's a handful. You know. (MORE)
JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women who look a certain way, they need to be managed. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind my saying, you got a lot on your shoulders for a kid. Your pal, Amy? She's ripe. Must be a line of guys dying to pluck that. Your mom too -- you don't see it, maybe you do -- she's giving it off. It's on you to watch out for them. You up for that? Charlie's burning. But holds himself in check. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can manage. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Cause there are bad people out there, man. Better keep an eye on your women. Jerry backs away, intimidating even as he retreats. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the beers. Charlie watches him move into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie bursts into his room, freaked out -- races to the window. His room is free of all geekery. Now it's all sports and sneakerhead stuff. AMY's there -- on his bed and surrounded by school books. She's reading Wuthering Heights. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've you been? You told me to meet you here an hour ago. CHARLIE'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's nowhere to be seen and his house is quiet. Lights behind BLACKED OUT WINDOWS.
AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Charlie breaks away from the window. It's an effort. His focus is still half there, even as he tries to talk to Am CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. You okay? Everything okay? He checks his phone. Checks for anything from ED. Nothing AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why shouldn't it be? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it should. Nothing. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her book) You ever read this? It's good. Sexy, actually. Amy moves to Charlie. Puts her arms around him. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a frustrated, unconsummated sort of way. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like us, you mean. Amy laughs, pulls him onto the bed. She's feeling frisky. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda makes it hotter. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so you keep saying. He smiles a little. She kisses him. But feels his distanc AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I boring you? What's up? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. I'm kind of wiped out, that's all. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fix that. She kisses him again. Despite himself, Charlie gets drawn and turned on. She pulls back, serious.
AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to get under the covers? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- now? Seriously? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Let's just... see how it goes. Charlie's dying inside. Now?! Could not be a worse time. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believeme when I say--thereis nothing in the worldI'dratherdo BUT-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. Don't be nervous. She kisses him again. It's intense, passionate. Charlie weakens a little. Maybe death and mayhem can wait... Amy moves to take off her top. Oh. My. God-- DING DONG. Somebody is ringing the bell at Jerry's. Charl stops. Practically tosses Amy off him. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that? He rushes to the window. Looks outside. CHARLIE'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DORIS is at Jerry's front door. Holding a bottle of wine. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JERRY comes to the door. He and Doris start chatting. She flirting up a storm. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, shit, shit-- Amy sees what Charlie sees. Shrugs. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hot. She's a stripper. They were bound to find each other.
CHARLIE GO-GO DANCER-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take away two tiny pieces of cloth, stripper. (LIGHTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jealous? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No-- Jerry is showing Doris in when he stops-and looks DIRECTL CHARLIE. It's chilling. Charlie DIVES away from the window, grabbing Amy and pull her down too. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked right at us. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Not a big deal-- Charlie's freaked now. Doris is IN THERE. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it is a big. A very big. He saw us and he was pissed. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Amy moves away. Looking at him skeptically. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not into this, say so. Don't do me any favors. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! I am, I totally am. just -- I don't trust that guy. He glances out the window again. Amy's irritated, not use to having her passes rejected. She gathers her stuff. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy. Don't--
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You've got your neighborhood watch thing. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't be that way-- But she's gone. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap! A beat. Charlie's torn -- he should go after her. But Doris's muted LAUGH from the other house draws his attent He looks again at Jerry's house. He can see faint shadows moving behind the windows in the house, like ghosts. Charlie's conflicted, freaked -- what can he do? He picks the phone. Dials 911. Then thinks better of it. Hangs up. Finally -- he stops at the window, eyes on JERRY'S PLACE. Listening and watching intently. Keeping sentry. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Charlie's fallen asleep in a chair by the window. He's startled awake by a woman's SCREAMS. They sound like they are coming from Jerry's. But are they screams of pleasure or pain? Charlie looks out the window. Jerry's house is dark. It's all quiet. Charlie looks at the clock. tam. Charlie sits back on his bed. Was it a dream? Then Charli hears A MOTOR START. Charlie goes back to the window. Jerry's TRUCK starts and Jerry drives off. Off Charlie, unsettled. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short while later. Charlie moves cautiously into Jerry' backyard. He's wearing ALL BLACK and his dad's old winter gloves. He looks at his iPhone. ON THE PHONE -- a diagram. "How to pick a lock."
Charlie steels his nerves. At Jerry's back door, he clums tries to pick the lock. After a moment or two, he realize he has no idea what he's doing. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap. He walks away from the door, frustrated. Then turns and impulsively tries to KICK IN the DOOR with his foot. Noth happens. Then something occurs to Charlie. He goes into the garden CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Perrys... Charlie finds a FAKE ROCK. Turns it over. It has a KEY in it. Charlie's like -- duh. He puts the key in the back door lock. It opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie moves through the first story of the house. He's cautious, on edge. At first the place seems totally unremarkable. A typical "guy pad". Lots of inexpensive furniture, bad art, a salt water fish tank... At every turn, Charlie expects something or someone to ju out at him. It's unbearably tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks upstairs. Moves through a plain white hallw finds an open door that leads to Jerry's office, where he keeps an EXTENSIVE LIBRARY. On one wall hangs a TAPESTRY that looks very old, decorat with a strange INSIGNIA. Charlie takes a picture of it wi his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie goes into Jerry's bedroom - opens his closet. See variety of UNIFORMS. Cop, gas man, UPS, etc. Charlie reacts, chilled. Charlie stops. JERRY'S TRUCK is pulling into the driveway Charlie's in a panic. Jerry will be inside any moment.
There's no time to get out so Charlie ducks into the CLOS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie pushes as far back into the closet as he can go. Leans against the back wall. The BACK OF THE CLOSET SWINGS OPEN and Charlie falls back into a HIDDEN HALLWAY. Charlie stands, stunned, see that the hallway is lined by small rooms on either side. It's clear that these are additions Jerry's added. Each r has a small rectangular WINDOW, so you can see in. Charlie reacts, sick. It looks like a prison. Despite the danger, he creeps over and looks in one of the rooms--

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: A pale HAND slaps against the window. Charlie jumps. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! -- DORIS is in the window now. Bruised and so pale she looks almost BLUE. DORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Oh, shit-- Charlie tugs on the door. Locked. He stands back, what to do? Charlie hears a NOISE. The FRONT DOOR. And then -- JERRY'S FOOTSTEPS approaching. DORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Oh no... Get me out of here! Doris pounds on the door. In a cold panic. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -- I won't leave you-- But Charlie has no choice. The footsteps are getting CLOS DORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! No! Don't go!

Charlie ducks inside one of the CELLS across from Doris, moves behind the door. JERRY steps into the hallway, walks right by Charlie's hi place. Pauses near him. The door is ajar. Was it that way before? Charlie holds h breath. Jerry moves to the CELL and retrieves DORIS's half-alive from it. Charlie cautiously looks through the crack in the door. DORIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .no... . God, no... please... The door to Doris's cell open. Charlie can see PART of Doris's body and face. Jerry is mostly obscured, bent over Doris -- holding her. Charlie watches helplessly, horrified. DORIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please... don't kill me. Doris's body TENSES and starts to jerk, as Jerry TUGS AND RIPS AT IT SAVAGELY. It's clear he's FEEDING ON HER, although we can't see his face. Doris screams, then starts to cry. It's stark and REAL an terrifying. It seems to go on and on. Doris weakens, her head lolling one side, her light fading. A small stream of blood spreads across the white pavement In the position she's in, she is eye to eye with CHARLIE. She sees him, smiles weakly. Then mouths something -- too weak to make much sound. DORIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cha... Cha... CHARLIE is petrified. Doris gets it -- smiles a little grimly, puts a finger to her lips. Silence. After what seems like an eternity, Jerry is satisfied. He tosses Doris aside and stands away from her. Charlie DUCKS behind the door as Jerry emerges and casual wipes a spot of blood from his mouth.

Then Jerry LOCKS DORIS back into her cell. Pockets the ke and moves off toward the stairs. After a moment, he's gon The sound of a TV starts in Jerry's living room. Somethin banal like "The Real Housewives of Orange County." Charlie knows this is his moment. With shaking hands, he retrieves his iPhone and pulls up the "HOW TO PICK A LOCK screen. Charlie looks through the window in Doris's cell. She's breathing -- alive. Charlie whispers to himself as he uses a bobby pin and a screwdriver on the lock. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... Please... The bobby pin slips. Drops. Charlie's losing it. Steadies himself. Tries again. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. The tension is unbearable. Charlie can hear JERRY moving downstairs. CLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lock slides open. Charlie breathes with relief. Then grabs Doris and BOLTS. Charlie SLIPS in a pool of blood left behind from Jerry's feeding, but he manages to stay on his feet. He pushes Doris ahead of him, to a BACK STAIRCASE. His PHONE drops out of his pocket, he has to double back every moment counts. Doris's barely aware of what's happening, let alone where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later. Charlie and Doris emerge downstairs, near the entry hall. They can see the front door -- and hear Jerry moving in another room. Charlie looks around, trying to get oriented. JERRY emerges -- almost sees them. Charlie ducks into a hiding spot and grabs Doris, covering her mouth.
A long beat as Jerry returns to the living room with a be Settles in a chair facing away from the door. Charlie considers his options. Says almost silently: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same floor plan. He grabs Doris and bolts for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A back door. Leading out. Charlie and Doris race for it, DORIS stumbles and bumps into a chair. Stifles a cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry turns at the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie throws the back door open, he and DORIS ESCAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just starting to rise. Charlie races for his house, with Doris holding on to him tight. She's crying w gratitude and relief, manages-- DORIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you... Doris looks up at him, her EYES TURNING BLACK, her veins going gray. A first ray of pure sunlight hits them. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris? In a flash, DORIS starts to BURN. Charlie is helpless to it as she GOES UP IN FLAMES and explodes. CHARLIE REACTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified. In shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry moves into the kitchen.
The back door is closed now -- but the blinds sway slight And there are BLOODY prints on the floor from Charlie's sneakers. Jerry takes this in, coldly furious. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sits on his bed -- still in a state of shock. Thi shit is for real. Jane comes to the door, her knock cursory. She enters. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be late. Jane moves to the windows, throws the curtains open. Char winces at the sun. He got no sleep, looks like hell. JANE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hours you keep. It's like living with a vampire. Charlie stops. Looks at her. She has no idea. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen -- promise me -- that guy next door, Jerry? Under no circumstances do you invite him into our house. He's dangerous. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can handle myself. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no you can't-- JANE CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie-- Don't even look in his direction, understand? And at night, you stay inside. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's dangerous. What kind of dangerous? Charlie starts gathering his things. Getting ready to bol
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you trust me? For once, don't ask a million questions-- JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. Stop. I'm your mom, not some ridiculous woman-- CHARLIE (GENUINE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Okay? I know... We just don't have time for a big thing! I'm telling you-- JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. I'm done with this conversation. She moves away. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom-- But she's gone. Charlie looks after her, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Charlie approaches the school. Kids swarm around him, happy and care-free. Charlie's in another world.

dialogues.speaker: A COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: As various pages pop up-- VAMPIRE FAQ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True VAMPIRE tales! VAMPIRE chat city How to kill a vampire ON CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he scrolls and frantically scribbles notes.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE'S NOTE PAD/COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: As Charlie notes tons of CONTRADICTORY facts;

Vamps must avoid all daylight. Vamps can walk in fog or twilight. Vamps always sleep in the dirt. Vamps never sleep. Vamps can only die from stake through the heart. Vamps only die from Fire. Three bites to turn a victim into a vamp. One bite and th victim has to feed from the vamp... Vamps change form -- bats, animals, etc. Vamps absolutely can NOT shape-shift. ON CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now that he's on a computer in the SCHOOL LIBRARY, isolated behind some stacks. He clicks a link on one of the sites -- which leads him t PETER VINCENT'S website. It's an elaborate interactive si It says that Vincent is a serious student of all things occult -- especially VAMPIRES -- and has amassed a vast collection of books and artifacts. It also claims that there are different TRIBES of vampire

dialogues.speaker: ON CHARLIE'S NOTEBOOK
dialogues.text: He writes in big letters

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Charlie looks up. Amy stands over him, a little wary. Charlie covers his writing and closes his computer screen He looks like hell. Disheveled, sleep deprived, tense. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't in class. What are you working on? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porn. Hacked it.
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good. I thought it was something creepy. Charlie nods. Smiles wanly. Then-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd better... AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to your porn. Got it. She looks away, losing patience. Charlie rallies. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sorry. I'm just -- I could use some coffee. She looks back. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Amy sit in the busy quad. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't hang out at my house any more. My mom's flipping out about some stuff. I can see you at school, but for a while -- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What's going on? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to explain. Just... What can he say? He has to protect her, but how? BEN AND MARK Join them. Notice how tweaked Charlie looks. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like dog shit. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pal the spaz, his folks were here earlier. It's a big thing. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?
MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He ran away or something. They were all upset, talking to the principal. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One less tweaker clogging up the halls. Charlie stands, upset. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. MARK BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie-- Chill out- CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're talking about. He could be dead for all you know. Mark steps in. Calming, reasonable. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Not cool. You're worried and it's totally understandable. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's better off, man. He'll be happier with the other trolls on the shire. That's it. Charlie DECKS MARK. They go to the ground and Charlie lets loose on him. A bunch of other guys pull the apart amid shouts, etc. Mark is bloodied and freaked. MARK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck man!? AMY stands back, appalled. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!! What the hell is wrong with you?! CHARLIE (TO MARK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an idiot, you know that? (SUPER EMPHATIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's HOBBITS on the shire!
Charlie turns to Amy-- CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. But she shakes her head and moves to MARK and BEN. CHARLIE (CONT'D) AMY-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get out of here, Charlie. Go. He knows it's over. Heartbroken, he takes off. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gets off the bus and walks toward one of the nice hotels. He's looking at another "how to" on his phone. "How to me a celebrity."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charlie grabs a LAS VEGAS SUN from a rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie watches a bunch of CONVENTIONEERS with BADGES in FOOD COURT. A guy about Charlie's size leaves his coat and badge on h chair -- goes to get his food. Charlie sweeps in and quietly takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PETER VINCENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40's, but all wiry rock n' roll attitude. Leather pants a tattoos, Long black hair wrapped in a bandana. Dark paint nails and heavy eye make-up. HEAVY METAL MUSIC BLARES.

The whole scene is OVER THE TOP GOTH cheesiness. Lots of stage effects and fire... PAMELA ANDERSON look-alikes in skimpy outfits prance on s as another SEXY GIRL is handcuffed, S&M style, to a C TORTURE BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: We see that this is a run-through. Tech guys work light boards, etc. A director and scattered others sit in the seats. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sneaks in one of the back doors. Silently moves close to stage. He's WEARING THE STOLEN COAT. The badge holder now has the SUN masthead logo inside. It looks, at first glance, like a legit credential. ON STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter reveals a tray full of SHARP DAGGERS. He raises the to the audience. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knives are real. He CUTS his OWN PALM with one, bleeds. Doesn't even wince Stud. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is real. He GRABS HER, feels her up. She giggles. SEXY ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooo! Peter YANKS down on the circular board the assistant's ti to -- sending her SPINNING. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I miss, she'll really be dead. The music switches. It's all TENSION. Peter FLINGS a dagger. SCHWACK! The assistant DUCKS as the KNIFE embeds the board behind her, this close where her head was. She screams! Breaks character.
SEXY ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Shit! Pete! Also out of character -- PETER speaks in a thick QUEEN'S ACCENT. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't say that! (moves to her) Stop the-- STOP. CUT!! The music stops. The spinning board stops. SEXY ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost tore my extensions out! Why do you have to throw a real knife!? PETER (RE: KNIFE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It barely cuts! That board is like butter. He tears the MAKEUP appliance off his hand that made it l like he cut himself. The assistant pulls out of her VELCR straps. SEXY ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody else fakes it! PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this looks authentic-- SEXY ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then learn how to throw! She stomps off the stage. Peter can't believe it. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw this. He starts to stalk off stage. CHARLIE rushes toward him. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vincent! Mr. Vincent-- A tech guy moves in on Charlie. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Brewster. From the Sun? We had an appointment. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Talk to my guy.     55 CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing a piece -- "Vampires. Separating myth from fact." PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a comment? That's a shit idea for an article. Peter starts to move off. Charlie, anxious, follows. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I really -- I need your expertise. You're the man on this stuff, right? Peter sees how desperate Charlie is. Stops. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, like your first assignment? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually -- yeah. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes this in/then) Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter lives in a two story penthouse at the top of one of casino hotels that he works in. It's lavish, floor to ceiling windows, etc. Still, goth influence reigns. The decor is tacky Haunted Mansion all the way. Charlie is shown into the "museum" by Peter's ASSISTANT, ARTHUR, who looks and sounds A LOT LIKE PETER. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch anything, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie enters -- comes face to face with a SNARLING WEREWOLF. He starts. Then realizes it's a life-size model CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho -- wow.
Charlie stands back, takes in the place. It's an amazing combination of FANTASY memorabilia and ACTUAL occult weap and objects. It seems to go on and on. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got rooms of this crap. Ebay. Charlie examines a case that holds all kinds of TORTURE DEVICES and battle axes, as well as SPIKED BALL MACES, et Cases hold ancient texts and scrolls, haunted objects, et CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. Charlie is genuinely impressed. The geek in him can't hel it. Peter enters, talks to Arthur-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midori me. Arthur pours Peter a green drink as Peter pulls off his b wig (bandana attached) and peels off a nude body shirt th has a bunch of TATTOOS printed on it. He steps out of his boots, with three-inch LIFTS. Collaps into an arm chair. He's just another balding, middle-aged guy with bad eyes. Peter downs his drink. Arthur hands him the bottle. Peter looks at Charlie. In truth, Peter's isolated himself to the point that he actually welcomes a visitor -- though he'd never admit it PETER (CONT'D) (RE: MIDORI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like pee but I'm hooked. You want? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks. Not...on the job. Peter scratches avidly at his crotch. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leather, it doesn't breath. You know? Fucking rashes are killing me... So I'm your expert, huh? For your vampire thing. (BITTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all the rage, huh.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess... So -- say I want to kill one. But really. How how would you do it? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. You got fire, beheading. Or go classic -- stake through the heart. Bam! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all that actually works? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck do I know. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you're-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read books, man. You think I'm hanging out with Dracula and the Easter Bunny? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. No. Charlie realizes he has no choice. He has to reveal more. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I have a personal interest in this story. (off Peter's look) A friend's missing, actually. I think one of them got him. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them, meaning a "vampire." CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry. He lives next door to me. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Jerry?" CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's no joke. If you look at these clips, you'll see. They take some time to load but... Charlie moves to Peter, shows him his phone. Digs into hi pocket.
CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I printed up some photos I took. In his place. Or lair... Charlie put the photos in front of Peter on the table. Peter's expression closes. He stands, pissed. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, come on, I'm-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a nutjob. Arthur! Charlie deflates -- his desperation showing again. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I saw it. I saw him kill a girl. She burned up in my hands. You have to tell me how to stop him. Arthur enters. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this loser out of my sight. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I saw. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't. See this guy? He gestures to ARTHUR. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin, Art. He's "me" on stage. That's how I teleport. People see what they want to see. CHARLIE (URGENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you've been looking for, I promise. I can take you to him, to his place. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Clark County Nevada. A hot bed of supernatural activity.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! It's genius. A transient population. A town where people work all night, sleep all day... PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
