dialogues.text: A town full of con-artists. (not buying it) No. You're working me, or somebody's working you. Charlie's getting angry now. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already got my friend! I know how I sound. But I'm not crazy. I didn't want this. I don't want to know this. Just tell me what to do! Peter feels Charlie's sincerity. For a moment he looks genuinely conflicted. But his expression hardens. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. He moves away. But Charlie is on his heels. Peter looks t ARTHUR, nods. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I save my own skin so he can keep killing!? I won't. We have to kill him! Please!-- Arthur THROWS Charlie out, the door closed firmly behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands, shut out. What the hell is he going to do now? FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving in on the Brewster home, an odd sight is revealed. Every window is draped with strings of GARLIC. Charlie's revealed in his window -- hammering up another rope of the stuff. His gaze falls on JERRY'S HOUSE and we follow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we find that Charlie's entire room is decked out in a vamp decor. Not just the garlic but crosses and other religious pictures, etc. Charlie LOOKS at the clock -- night coming too quickly. H grimly focused as he starts sharpening a STAKE. A knock. Jane doesn't enter this time. Another knock. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Jane walks in. Takes in the decor. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole house looks like that show Dark Shadows. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gag. For Amy. Long story. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes this in/then) You like her a lot, don't you? A moment when they could connect. But Charlie just nods. Jane's disappointed. Then-- JANE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't use tape on the walls. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Ed's parents left a few messages, looking for him. Charlie looks up at this. Pained. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He goes back to his work. Jane looks at him for a beat, t she starts to go.
THE DOORBELL RINGS. Before Jane can really react, Charlie pushes past her. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T. Don't open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie races downstairs. Stops. AMY is standing in the living room. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in?! AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was unlocked. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM! You have to lock the door! AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever, listen. You're flipping out. Punching out your friends and blowing everything off and is that a stake? A beat. He forgot he was holding it. He hides it behind h back. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Amy sits, upset. Looks around and sees that the living ro is decked in more anti-vamp decor. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Even if you're losing it -- you don't get to blow me off. You don't go from something to nothing overnight. (EMOTIONAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not nothing to me, Charlie. Whatever's happening, just -- talk to me. Charlie takes this in, emotional. But-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you get hurt. You need to forget about me for a while.
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? How am I going to get hurt? Tell me. Charlie-- Now there's another KNOCK at the door. Jane comes downsta JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO. Don't answer it. A tense moment. Another knock. INNERCUT WITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY stands at the door. Quietly enraged. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous-- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane. It's Jerry from next door-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, don't answer it! JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my house. I'll answer the door if I want to. She starts to move to the door again. Charlie blocks her way, desperate. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. He murdered Ed and Adam. And I have proof. Jane is stunned, at a loss. From the other side of the do

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jane? I need to talk to you. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just-- Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Now. Your son is harassing me! He pounds on the door. Jane examines Charlie closely.     63 JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. What's happening? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever he says, don't--

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He broke into my house. I'd rather not take this to the authorities. But I will! He's sick, deluded-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. A tense beat... Finally-- JANE (YELLS/ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the authorities! My son is a good kid! Charlie sags with relief. A brief look of appreciation passes between Charlie and Jane. ON JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he backs away from the door. His expression goes cold. He disappears into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie races to a window. SEES JERRY MOVE out of sight. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, shit... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is he doing? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry stands back, intense. He's got to take care of this problem NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's running from window to window now, trying to se what's going on.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just -- if we stay in here -- he has to give up. He can't get in without an invitation. AMY OH-- (GETTING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Really? Like a-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampire. Really. Amy and Jane are blown away. Charlie's going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry carries a SHOVEL and A SMALL SAW. He stalks into th Brewster's backyard, where he's hidden from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane follows Charlie, worried. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about what you're saying-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have. I've "processed," believe me. Jane takes this in. Then SMILES. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh. This is the gag! For Amy. I can't believe you got Jerry to go along with it! Charlie stops. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: As he starts to DIG UNDERGROUND -- amazingly strong and swift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hands Amy and Jane both CROSSES on CHAINS.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take these. Put them on. Just do it. JANE (HUMORING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okaaaay. Vampire protection! AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is funny. But she puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry pulls up the NATURAL GAS LINE that leads to the BREWSTER'S HOUSE. He SAWS IT OPEN AND LIGHTS THE END ON FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hisssssssssss. A strange sounds coming from under the flo AMY WHAT'S THA--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!! The GAS FIREPLACE EXPLODES, the STOVE EXPLODES, TH WATER HEATER ALL EXPLODE at once!! WINDOWS BLOW OUT as Charlie JUMPS on Jane and Amy, draggi them to the ground. The room starts to BURN. Charlie, Amy and Jane are in a panic. They try to put the fire out, but it's no use. Charlie stops. A CHILLING SIGHT: Jerry stands on the other side of the blown-out windows. expression dark. Through the flames he says-- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need an invitation if there's no house. A beat. Charlie GRABS Amy and Jane and they RUN through t house.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BREWSTER GARAGE/STREET
dialogues.text: y, Charlie and Jane race into the garage
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can drive-- JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive! They jump into Jane's car. Hit the garage opener-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun it Mom! Go!!! Jane GUNS IT THROUGH THE OPENING GARAGE DOOR, destroying She CLIPS Charlie's dirt bike -- pushing it onto the side as she takes off. Jane's car swings wide into the street, almost smashing i an arriving FIRE ENGINE! Charlie, Amy and Jane SCREAM!! They narrowly avoid a head-on collision with a FIRE TRUCK ON JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he sees the dirt bike in the driveway. He jumps on. Tries to start it. NO GO. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we do!? What does he want!? They are racing away when the DIRT BIKE COMES CRASHING THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW of the car, nearly taking Amy's h off. AMY HOLY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone reacts. Then the BIKE STARTS - the wheels spinni wildly in the back seat. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy! Amy's hair gets caught in the spokes - it's horrible as i YANKS part of her hair out. Charlie grabs her away from the bike -- she falls into hi arms, crying as JERRY's BIG PICKUP appears in the rear windshield.
JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane speeds down the street, which is wide and not heavil trafficked here. Unlike the planned community of Shadow Hills -- now we ca see we're surrounded by great expanses of empty DESERT. JERRY'S TRUCK SMASHES REPEATEDLY into JANE'S. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother has a gun! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know! Is he here?! JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the police! Anybody-- Jane manages to evade Jerry until -- The TRUCK SKIDS in a long arc in front of them and BLOCKS THEM. Jane screeches to a halt. JANE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell. In a flash, Jerry is out of the truck and coming for them CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO! Go! Don't stop!! Go-- Charlie steps on the accelerator, grabs the wheel and AIM THE CAR AT JERRY. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!! They RUN JERRY OVER WITH A TERRIBLE THUDDDD!!! Amy and Ja scream. Jane is aghast, stops the car. JANE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!! Charlie steps on her accelerator foot, the CAR ZOOMS FORW
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts!? You can't kill that guy! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea. (TO JANE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him or us. Mom. MOM. Jane looks at him -- can feel that he's telling the truth Charlie's looking around as they speed down the highway, the rearview. NO JERRY anywhere. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where'd he go? Everybody looks UP. The roof of the car. BAM! Jerry's hand SHOOTS up through the FLOORBOARD under Jane's feet. Jane and Amy SCREAM!

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR OF THE CAR
dialogues.text: JERRY'S EYE glares through the small hole. It's all BLACK No pupil. Freaky. He's TEARING THROUGH METAL from the undercarriage of the where he's clinging -- face up. The more he rips away -- the more he reveals his face. His veins and eyes are BLACK. His nose snout-like. And hi fangs emerge from lethal rows of jagged teeth, like a SHA It's shocking, horrible.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE UNDERSIDE OF THE CAR
dialogues.text: As Jerry drags over the highway, the pavement grinding aw at his clothes and flesh. He reaches through the hole he's made and SLAMS his fist on the FLOOR BREAK. The car SCREECHES to a sudden halt. ON CHARLIE, AMY and JANE Screaming even after the car has stopped. Then -- BAM!! T car is REAR-ENDED by another vehicle. It's a MINIVAN. JANE's car is SLAMMED -- the back is a crush of glass and metal.
A GRIM MOMENT -- only the sound of hissing air and groani steel as everyone assesses the damage. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Are you-- Jane? Jane is woozy. Hurt. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay... Charlie sees that the other car is drivable. The guy insi a FAMILY MAN, is stunned and pissed. Gets out of his car- FAMILY MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing!-- Charlie gets out of the car too. Yells, urgent-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! Hey man, stay in your-- But it's too late. The guy is met by a HORRIFIC Jerry, hideously torn and bleeding, who appears from UNDER JANE' CAR. In a flash, Jerry grabs the guy and VAMPS, ripping the fa man's NECK OUT.

dialogues.speaker: MINIVAN
dialogues.text: As those "cute" stick figure family decals are splattered with BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: AMY AND JANE
dialogues.text: Now out of the car, react. JERRY IS A FUCKING VAMPIRE. Jerry drops the business man, who's dead as he hits the ground. He moves toward them. Charlie looks at Amy and Jane. I told you so. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Charlie urgently grabs them. Shoves them down the highway CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. Run. Run!
AMY BUT-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! I'll catch up! She's hurt, get out of here! They back off. Charlie pulls a large cross out of his coat and brandishe as he walks toward Jerry. Jerry keeps his distance, taunt HIM-- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them run. Just makes them easier to kill when I'm done with you. Ding, ding, ding -- the family man's CAR DOOR is open and warning bell rings over and over... CHARLIE eyes the car. Keys still in it. He circles Jerry, backing him off. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I repel you with the power of Christ the Lord. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Really? When did you take your last confession? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back... JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a mighty big cross you have there. Question is -- do you actually know how to use it? Jerry LUNGES for Charlie, but he DIVES for the family man open car door. But Jerry's on him -- hands BURNING as he rips the cross Charlie and shatters it with his hand. Then he TOSSES Charlie, who flies and hits JANE'S CAR, th crumples to the ground. Jerry gets Charlie around the neck -- holds a sharp, splintered end of the broken cross against Charlie's ches The wood still burns into Jerry's hand, but Jerry holds o
JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever take one of these in the chest? I have. Charlie struggles, terrified. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they missed the heart. Rigggght... . here. Easy measurement. Jerry positions the "stake" right over Charlie's heart. Charlie winces. Terrified and overpowered. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't have been so nosey. Jerry's about to plunge the STAKE through Charlie's heart when a THICK WOOD STAKE comes through Jerry's SHOULDER. Jerry HOWLS, falls off Charlie and we see that he's been staked by the business end of a REAL ESTATE SIGN. JANE stands over them, quaking with fear and adrenaline. Amy's right behind her with a CROWBAR. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave my kid alone. Jane collapses, and we see that there's a lot of BLOOD on back of her head. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Jerry's in agony as he stumbles away, pulls the sign post of his shoulder. Charlie grabs his mom and drags her into her wreck of a c Amy dives into the car with them. Charlie presses the accelerator. Will it still drive? CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on come on come on... IT LURCHES forward, then goes. Metal scraping the ground, raining glass... but it RUNS. They start to bolt when BAM! JERRY STANDS UP right in fro of the car, LUNGES AT THEM. CHARLIE RUNS OVER JERRY'S BOD AGAIN. They speed off.     72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry writhes in the middle of the road. But even as he does, he HEALS. His body knitting itself back together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's giving a report to a pair of uniformed cops. COP #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So a gas leak caused the fire at your home and... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom didn't feel right, we were trying to get her to the hospital. It was stupid to let her drive. COP #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it was. And driver who rear- ended you, you get the exact make and name of the van? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't there when you got there? COP #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit and run. Happens all the time. Charlie stifles his surprise. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: On her cell, pacing as she eyes Charlie with the cops. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't stay up all night. Bee and Cara need help with Trig -- it's not a party. Okay. Okay... (THEN/EMOTIONAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? I love you. She stops at the open door of a hospital ROOM. Her gaze FALLING ON-- JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who lies motionless in a bed. A doctor checks her chart. AMY hangs up. Charlie, finished with the cops, joins her. They're both pained as they look at Jane. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have said something to the police.     73 CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? A vampire moved next door, borrowed some beer, ate a stripper and then blew up our house because we wouldn't invite him in? Amy looks at him. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. The DOCTOR approaches. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get some rest. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to wake up, right? DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assuming the swelling is minimal, I hope so. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. We need to give it time. The doctor puts a hand on Charlie's shoulder, leaves. Charlie turns away, upset. Amy watches, feeling helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, in a bathrobe, looks out his floor-to-ceiling wind at the lights of the strip. The ASSISTANT from the show toddles out on high heels and ridiculous mini-dress. Her hair is messy, post sex. ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye babe. Good show tonight. He's barely paying attention. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were late again on "The Devil's Torture Chamber." But she's gone. A beat. He moves back toward the library shelves. As he does he notices the PHOTOS Charlie took at Jerry's place.

Absently, he sifts through them. Stops. He picks up the one of the INSIGNIA. Peter reacts. Stunned. This means something to him. He goes to a WALL SAFE. Opens it. Hidden inside are a bun of personal items. Some from his childhood. Old photos of his mother and father... And a hand-drawn sketch, in a youthful scrawl, of THE INSIGNIA. He puts the two side by side. They MATCH. Off PETER, looking at the sketches. Haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Amy sit on a tiny couch. Both are scared and regretful. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my fault. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't make any of it happen. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed came to me. I turned my back on him. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How were you supposed to believe him? None of it makes sense. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did talk a lot of demented crap. (but.. ) He was my best friend. He asked me, begged me, to believe him. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change. Everybody-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah they do. I turned into a dick. I figured my dweeb past, not big with the ladies. AMY (WRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying this is my fault.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you to like me. I tried to erase Ed -- all of it. I know how that feels. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were a dweeb. (off his look) You think I want a "dude" like Mark or Ben? I like that you're different... It didn't hurt that your skin cleared up. She smiles, takes his hand. A sweet, connected moment. Th something alarming occurs to Amy: AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we didn't have sex. CHARLIE AMY- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seriously. I'm going to die a virgin? Me? How did this happen? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to die-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if we do? Let's do it. Now. The bathroom. Charlie. A beat. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should kill the vampire first. I'll perform much better. They laugh -- trying not to cry. Then: AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Charlie. What are we going to do? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to fight. Then Charlie's phone rings. He answers. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? INNERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands with the photo of the insignia in hand. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you. My place. One hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minutes later. Charlie and Amy move out of Jane's room. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Peter Vincent? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under-whelming, believe me. But he's what we've got. They close Jane's door and we see that it's COVERED in CROSSES of every shape and size. It's quite a spectacle. A nurse passes, looks at Charlie and Amy quizzically. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom is very religious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIDORI cocktail WIDEN to reveal that PETER is pouring himself a whopper. and Charlie sit nearby. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I know, but that's it. Don't expect me to join your Scooby gang. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. I'll take it. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the origin of that insignia you showed me. It's a species that originated in the Mediterranean. They nest in the earth -- explains that hole you saw. And they kill slowly, keep their victims alive for days. (MORE)
PETER (CONT'D) (GRIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Snackers." CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- they turn all of them? (off Amy's look) Make their victims into vampires. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I read. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It takes a while before they complete the change. They usually finish them off before that. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you kill these guys, this "tribe"? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usual stuff. But it's a strong breed. You need a plan-- A VOICE interrupts over an intercom. It's ARTHUR, Peter's assistant.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Delivery. Guy says you need to sign for something. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him in. (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I order things when I've had a few cocktails. It's a-- CHARLIE (ALARMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. You get deliveries this late? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe-- Charlie stands. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You said he could come in. The delivery guy. That's-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Charlie--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: An invitation, airhead. They turn and see EVIL ED, in one of Jerry's "uniforms." It's clear he's changed. A glint in the eye, more muscula Charlie takes Ed in, pained. Ed grins at him. Ed flips open a cell phone. Dials. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at them now. Yes sir. (hangs up/then) He's modern, Jerry, dispensed with all that "master" stuff. (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey bud. Charlie steps in front of Amy. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a problem, keep it with me. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem? You let him get me, man. CHARLIE (ANGUISHED) I KNOW--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is CREEPING TOWARD Charlie. AMY CHARLIE-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him turn me into this. At that, ED VAMPS. Black eyes, black veins. Those teeth. It's terrifying. SMASH!! One of the cabinets shatters. Ed, Charlie and Amy spin to see PETER standing by the open collection case. A SMALL NAIL in his hand. He's shaking like a leaf. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away, demon. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused/queens accent) "Stay awaaaay, demon!" Ed closes in on Peter. Peter looks to Charlie. It's real.
ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha got there? Itsy bitsy little stakey? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crucifixion nail. Lethal to you. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old school. Nice. Got to get pretty close to use it, though. Peter looks at the short piece of metal in his hand. Fuck HE BOLTS down the nearest hallway. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh. No you don't. ED BOLTS AFTER PETER. Charlie and Amy race the other way. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pushes a BUTTON on a doorway, bolts into a PANIC RO Ed is on his heels, but JUST MISSES grabbing Peter before door closes. The POWERFUL DOOR CLOSES ON ED'S ARM, crushes it. ED HOWL as his arm SEVERS. The door LOCKS. But what doesn't kill him makes him stronger and crazier. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A panic room!? You better panic, loser! You better watch your neck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's in shock -- watching Ed's severed arm twitch on t floor.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Prince of darkness is a little baby man! I love it! All the fat chicks in your fan club are gonna be so bummed! He hears ED flipping out, but ED DOESN'T SHOW UP ON THE SECURITY SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie runs with Amy to the ELEVATOR. The CONTROL BOX ha been ripped from the wall. They're trapped. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, oh my God... Amy's starting to lose it. Charlie grabs her. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. Stop. (SHE DOES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another way out of here. And there are a million things to fight with in here. Understand? We're going to make it. Amy pulls herself together. Nods. They RUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE AND AMY race through the ROOMS of Peter's extensi collection.

dialogues.speaker: INNERCUT WITH ED
dialogues.text: Tracking them -- not far behind, his stub of an arm bleed and HEALING as he goes. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, Chuck! You're dead. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't ended up such a dick, I might have tricked you out. We could have rocked this evil shit! But you blew it. Nothing but the big dirt nap for you and your lady.

dialogues.speaker: AMY AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Round a corner -- it's a dead-end. They see a large antiq CONFESSIONAL at one end of the room. ON ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he comes around the same corner a moment later. AMY an CHARLIE are NOWHERE to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry enters, his appearance different. Healing from the incident has taken it out of him. He's pale and weakened -- and still has lots of cuts and bruises. He's also changed into new clothes, jeans and a SWEATER. We see THE SAME GUARD that Charlie spoke to earlier. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign in, please. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where I'm going. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign in. No exceptions. Jerry ignores him, keeps moving toward the elevator. GUARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I'm talking to you. Sign in, or you're not going nowhere. Jerry turns. Slow and deliberate. Expression cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is MOVING IN ON the CONFESSIONAL. Sees MOVEMENT behind the curtain. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expected more of a fight. Girl's made you lazy in the head. Pussy'll do that. ED YANKS the curtain on the confessional open. ARTHUR hides there, terrified. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. Vincent's got a Vincent. CLOSE ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large cabinet on the other side of the room. AMY AND CHARLIE are squeezed behind it. They react to HORRIBLE SCREAMS as Ed rips ARTHUR apart.
CHARLIE holds AMY close, muffling her sobs. Blood seeps across the floor, under their feet... ON ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face bloodied. Eyes wild. The trembling body of ARTHU on the ground at his feet. Ed turns Arthur over. Arthur's still breathing, reaches f something around his neck. A cross? No, it's a chain with PICTURES of sweet-faced children on silver charms. HE PLEADS-- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I have ...kids ... ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had. Ed lifts Arthur off his feet and chokes him with one hand ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it personal. I'd eat you -- but I'm saving my appetite. Arthur's turning a horrible purple, eyes bulging... Ed breaks his neck with a HORRIBLE WRENCHING CRUNCH. Drops h ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner with an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door to a STAIRWELL opens, Jerry steps into a hall. He looks healthy again. Robust. He wipes a small smear of blood from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY AND CHARLIE hold their breath as ED looks around the room. Arthur is motionless at his feet now. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're here. I can hear you breathing. It's totally cool. He laughs, hyper. Excited.
ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooo, I take out the prom king and queen? Embarrassment of riches! CHARLIE SHOVES the case he hides behind with Amy over ONT ED. Yells to Amy-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Amy bolts from the room as Charlie punches the glass out another case that holds the battle axe. He grabs the weap Ed SHOVES the cabinet off him with his good hand, stands. Charlie and Ed face off. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mano e...one mano. Piece of cake. Cause I'm a God Damned killing machine, and you're like all the Clark High big shots -- nothing. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked the wrong side, man. Ed lashes out, slicing CHARLIE on the arm with his SHARP NAILS. Charlie yells, but holds his ground. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't pick-- ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think. Charlie's wrecked about what he has to do. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry. Charlie takes a swing with the AXE. Ed starts BOUNDING around the room, avoiding Charlie's swings as he clings t walls and, impossibly, THE CEILING. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steeeerike! Call that a swing, Slugger? Charlie swings and swings, but Ed is too fast for him. Finally, Charlie connects with ED'S NECK. Blood flies, Charlie can't look -- anguished.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on! You're not even trying.
Charlie looks back, Ed's HEAD is only HALF OFF. He's grinning even as he bleeds everywhere. It's macabre, horrible. Ed SLASHES Charlie again with his claw-like nails. Charli cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy can hear Charlie yell. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! She smashes into one GLASS CABINET after another, pulling and pocketing everything she can find to fight ED. Finds GUN loaded with silver bullets... JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are something, aren't you? Amy spins. Jerry's closing in on her. Beautiful, seductiv She's shaking, terrorized. BAM, BAM, BAM!! She empties the GUN into JERRY anyway. It knocks him back but he's still standing. He picks a silver bullet out of shoulder, unimpressed. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Werewolves. Amy FLINGS holy water in his face. JERRY SCREAMS, burns. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires. She RUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED is already starting to heal as he and Charlie continue fight. But his head still flops hideously to one side. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bone is a motherfucker, Chuckles. Hard to cut. Charlie takes another swing with his axe. Ed jumps out of the way.
Ed manages to get Charlie in a one-arm embrace of sorts, positions himself so he can BITE HIS NECK. ED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this weird for you too? I feel like such a homo-- Charlie FLIPS ED -- they are wrestling when Charlie sees approaching with A SPIKED MACE. Charlie DUCKS and AMY smashes ED in the head. Hard. Charlie grabs a long, sharp piece of the shattered wooden cabinet. Ed is on the ground. Moaning, laughing. Charlie has his shot. But he hesitates. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Charlie! Charlie's frozen. Ed starts to get up, his head a mess. It's now or never. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Bimbo has some juice-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's here. He's coming! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ed/pained) I'm sorry. WHAP, Charlie stakes ED in the heart. Ed looks at Charlie with surprise... Ed's hideous features seem to dissolve. For a brief momen he looks like himself again. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't even a badass vamp. I was his Renfield. Funny if you-- Ed starts to VIBRATE HORRIBLY, his WHOLE BODY moving so impossibly fast he's little more than a BLUR... Then he BURNS UP FROM THE INSIDE OUT. Charlie's paralyzed -- in a world of hurt. Amy grabs him. Pulls him out of the room.
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the stairs. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY, VAMP-FACED and recovering from the holy water, see AMY and CHARLIE running up ahead. He sprints after them. Charlie sees him and TOPPLES A GIA FIGURINE in his path, as well as cabinets, etc... They slow Jerry down enough to get slightly ahead. AMY OVER HERE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flings the door to the stairwell open and they RACE D THE STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sits huddled in a corner, ashamed and shaking. The SECURITY CAMERA flicks through different rooms, until lands on his dead cousin, ARTHUR. It's like Peter's looking at his own mutilated corpse. OFF PETER, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Charlie emerge from the stairway. They find themselves ON THE FLOOR of a HARD ROCK TYPE CAS which is on the bottom of the building where Peter lives. Amy slows as they fold into the crowds. Relieved. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Stop, I need to-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. He's coming for us. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't kill us, not here-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to notice? Who's going to care? Amy, look around--
Amy takes in the people on the floor. Drunk, oblivious. T guys YELL and FIGHT at a craps table. A couple makes out a dark corner, etc. It's loud, chaotic. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving. Come on. Now Charlie sees JERRY some distance behind them now, mov toward them in the crowd. They meet eyes. Charlie grabs Amy, scans for someplace to hide. He spots nightclub -- "REFLECTIONS". The outside walls are all mirrored, like a brightly lit diamond. ON JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them in the crowd, he sees them slip into the club

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inside of the club is made up of MIRRORS AND WINDOWS. The dance floor is PACKED. All writhing bodies and sweaty abandon. It's dizzying, disorienting. Charlie sees JERRY enter, look around for them. The best to get lost is to dive into the crowd. Charlie leads Amy through the throngs of people -- the different levels of the club are like a maze. Glass staircases lead to mirrored balconies... A hopped-up DJ climbs up on a balcony, starts throwing t- shirts into the crowd. DJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tequila Man t-shirts! Yeeeeeahhhh! The crowd goes nuts, SURGES forward... Someone bumps Amy and Charlie and they lose hands. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! Charlie turns, a DRUNK CHICK gets in his way -- tries to dance with him. He pushes past her.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy? Amy! Charlie can't see Amy, instead sees HIMSELF over and over again in a series of mirrors -- the infinity effect. It's dizzying, disorienting. THEN HE SEES JERRY, a shark, moving in and out of the cro disappearing behind mirrored columns, reemerging... Charlie also sees that JERRY DOESN'T REFLECT in the mirro around them. Instead the crowd parts as if by magic. Jerry's heading straight toward-- AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who's been pushed toward the DJ stand by the crowd. She's spinning, looking desperately for Charlie. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy! Charlie's frantically pushing toward her. But the CRUSH o people makes it nearly impossible to gain ground.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: As a HAND slips into hers. She turns, relieved, to find-- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding her with a firm grip. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No! Amy STRUGGLES and CRIES OUT as JERRY PULLS HER away from CHARLIE, toward ramp that leads to another dance floor. Jerry laughs, throws her over his shoulder. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!! A GUY in the crowd high-fives him. All part of another cr night in Vegas. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get her, man! AMY sees her fast-moving reflection in the mirror -- she appears to be FLOATING above the people.
AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! Help!! CHARLIE can SEE HER, but can't get to her. The crowd is indifferent to her cries. Charlie grabs his cell -- hits a button. It dials, then-- CHARLIE (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter! We're in the casino, the club! Jerry's got Amy! He's got HER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's holding his cell. It's ringing. He hangs up. INT. REFLECTIONS -- SECOND STORY -- CONT. Jerry, hidden away from Charlie now, puts Amy down. She tries to run, but he holds her tight. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's coming, he'll find me-- JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm counting on it. Amy SPITS on him. Jerry reacts -- a flash of RAGE and he exposes his brutal rows of TEETH for just an instant. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. He grips her harder, sways with her to the music. Leans close to her ear, seductive. His predatory skills in high gear. JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need a taste. You'll see. It can be like a dream. Jerry draws a nail over his wrist, draws a line of blood. puts his mouth over the cut, bloodying it. He forces her into a DEEP KISS. She struggles mightily -- but then her body relaxes, as if she's been sedated.
JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it... Good girl. JERRY looks up sees CHARLIE coming toward them. But Amy's altered now. Staring into Jerry's eyes like a child. CHARLIE'S GETTING CLOSER when-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy! No!-- BAM! A hand falls on his shoulder. A DOORMAN DOORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help me. That guy, he's going to kill her, he's a KILLER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorman glances at JERRY and AMY. Jerry stokes Charli anguish -- running his hands over Amy's ass, kissing her neck. DOORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Then she's liking it. Charlie's beside himself, enraged and terrorized. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand!-- DOORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ID. Then you can tell me your whole sad story-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! There's no time-- Amy!! Charlie's increasingly desperate, tries to RUN. But the doorman has a good grip, pulls him back. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees that CHARLIE is restrained. Jerry locks eyes with Charlie and SMILES, his horrible fa exposed. He's taking Charlie's woman -- and enjoying it.
CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! NO! CHARLIE'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he's being dragged away -- JERRY BRUTALLY BITES AMY. It's a nightmare. Charlie loses it, screaming and flailing. But there is no helping her. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter packs a bag, getting out of town.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I see you got my message. Peter turns. Sees Charlie standing in the doorway. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security's a little lax. Everybody got their throat ripped out. Peter backs away as Charlie moves in. Charlie is different. Colder, harder. Like he's aged a decade in one night. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too? He change you? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your monitor. PETER turns to a security monitor in his closet. Charlie SHOWS UP ON THE SCREEN. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if Amy's alive or dead or turned -- but he's got her. My mom may not make it. And Ed... (COLD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to end him, or he's going to end me. (MORE)     92 CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One way or the other, that's how it's going to be and you're going with me. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get what this is? There's no fighting. There's only surviving, if you're lucky-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call this surviving? If you live and we all die, you think you'll ever be able to get us out of your head? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I won't. I never could -- not after the first time. This stops Charlie. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told myself I probably made it up. I was a kid. Maybe it was easier to believe in monsters... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made what up? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire who killed my parents, my brothers. But not me. I hid. Charlie reacts. Surprised, but now it all makes sense. Peter continues, haunted-- PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't collect all this stuff for fun. I thought maybe I could find the tribe, "avenge" my people. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do it. We'll go in at dawn. He's got to rest sometime-- PETER (HARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that. When I was a kid, I hid because I wanted to live. I still do! This isn't the comics. You want to be a dead hero. Good for you. But I'm out. (THEN) (MORE)
PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a coward. I'm just a realist. Moment of hesitation for Charlie. Has he been affected by Peter's words? Then-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you bail on people, erase them. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to make it to tomorrow, not if you're the kind of man I have to be. A moment. Peter is full of self-loathing, but resolved. Charlie turns to leave. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Peter takes something from his luggage. A stake carved fr WHITE WOOD. He hands it to Charlie. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blessed by Saint Michael. Kill a vampire with it -- it's supposed to turn his victims back. If Amy's changed, you can still save her. CHARLIE (RE: STAKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's for real. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows what's for real any more. Charlie takes the stake. Starts to go. Peter stops him-- PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no guarantee he'll be asleep during the day. He's housebound, not hibernating. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll figure it out. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you need a plan. To stake him, you have to get close -- he's stronger than you. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy water?     94 PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow him down. Won't stop him. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torch him, you'll have a few good minutes before he really goes up. Believe me, a vampire on fire isn't thinking clearly. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if he's on fire, how do I get close enough to stake him? A beat. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. CHARLIE (POINTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just worry about yourself. With that, Charlie leaves. Off PETER. Disgusted with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sits by Jane's bedside. She's still comatose. We move closer and see that Charlie's drawing a MAP OF JERRY'S HOUSE on some scrap paper -- laying it out from memory as best he can. He GLANCES at the clock as it ticks toward DA As Charlie plots, he talks to Jane -- his silent confidan CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those rooms upstairs, that's probably where he's got Amy. I get her out, assuming she's-- (NOT DEAD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have to get him on the ropes. He thinks... Then looks up, an idea occurring. Jane lies there peacefully. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. More energized, Charlie stands and gathers his things. He stops, contemplates his mother for a moment -- regretf
CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming back for you, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie buys FIREPROOF CLOTHING, a small open-flame light and a SPRAY CANISTER like the kind an exterminator uses. The guy at the counter looks Charlie up and down. Charlie takes this in. Finally, Charlie's like -- fuck it. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to kill a vampire. The guy looks at him. Then-- STORE GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. The store guy waits. Charlie hands over his money.

dialogues.speaker: ON JERRY'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: LOOMING, silhouetted against early morning light. Next to it, Charlie's house stands in charred ruins. CHARLIE stands on the front lawn, contemplating the house He wears fireproof clothes, has stakes and crosses strapp to him, holsters made out of duct-tape... Slung over his shoulder is the spray canister. And he hol a crowbar in a free hand. He looks like something out of of Ed's graphic novels. Before he enters, Charlie DOUSES HIMSELF IN HOLY WATER. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do this shit. He swallows hard, scared but determined.

dialogues.speaker: WET FOOTPRINTS
dialogues.text: Widen to find Charlie cautiously moving through the house The blacked-out windows give the place a gray, stifled ai Behind Charlie, we see that the front door has been broke open with the crow bar.
Charlie anxiously looks around for Jerry -- fully expecti him to jump out and go for his throat... He takes the stairs up to the second floor, two at a time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie moves down the hall, stops at some of the small rooms. Looks in. NO AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Charlie hears a GROAN. He opens a window in the door for yet another room. AMY'S lying on the floor, turned away from him. Charlie's not sure what he'll see when he gets a better look at her CHARLIE AMY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy slowwwwly gets up, turns... And aside from a BRUISED BITE MARK on her neck -- she loo normal. She rushes to Charlie, keeps her voice down. AMY CHARLIE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches through the window. They link hands, emotiona AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He dumped me here. I'm bait. He said so-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll survive. Please get out of here. He's too strong-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stronger. (WAVERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a nerd power way. You know...
He reaches into his jacket, pulls out a CROSS. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this. It should-- He looks up. AMY IS GONE. Disappeared. Charlie, reacts. Calls out in a hushed panic-- CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy? Amy!? Nothing. It's like she vaporized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie races down a hallway, looking for ANY. He tries door after door that won't open. He finally finds one door that's unlocked, rushes through almost FALLS through an open floor in an unfinished porti of the house. Jerry's building more cells. Charlie backs out of the doorway, turns a corner and BAM! He runs into JERRY. No, wait -- it's PETER. He's not wearing his wig, etc. But he's cleaned up and standing tall. Dressed all in black. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! You-- PETER CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry-- How'd you-- A beat. Then: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I don't want to be a man like me either. Peter opens his leather coat -- it's loaded with weapons. And a flask. Peter grins. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's kill something.
CHARLIE (RE: FLASK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You reek. Midori? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get greedy. I'm here. (THEN/PROUD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I found something else. From my collection. Powerful shit. From around his back, he reveals A DOUBLE-BARRELLED SHOTG with a CROSS MOUNTED ON THE BARREL. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooden bullets? Nice. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you think I'm fucking MacGyver? Bullet, bullets. They'll buy us some time. Charlie is grateful, but now's not the time for man hugs. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find Amy. She was in a room upstairs, then she just disappeared. This house-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean she "disappeared?" CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was there. I looked away, looked back -- she was gone. Peter takes this in. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Charlie pry open the door to the room where Amy held. Peter walks over the floor -- finds a TRAP DOOR. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floor trap. I use it all the time. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does it go? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out.
Peter lowers himself into the hole under the trap door-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- you're going in? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that? Like a great date. Get me drunk and I'll try anything. Peter lets go and FALLS. Charlie steels himself, goes in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! Charlie and Peter land painfully on a dirt floor. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, crap... They look around -- eyes adjusting. There's barely any light. They're in a LARGE UNFINISHED BASEMENT. The floor is dirt and the main story of the house is held up by numerous SUPPORT POSTS. At the far end of the basement there is a door that leads another room/storage area. ON CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he sees something. Stops. A MOUND of dirt. Like a grave. Charlie indicates to Peter to follow him. They whisper: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You uncover him. I'll light him up, then stake him. Charlie pulls a FABRIC MASK, like a ski mask, over his fa Peter looks at him. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flame retardant. They're standing over the grave now. Both nervous. Charlie nods to Peter. Peter does his best to hold the shotgun on the grave as he pushes the dirt aside with his free hand. He's shaking.
After a moment Peter UNCOVERS PART OF THE BODY. Then he moves up toward the face... Charlie douses the body with liquid from the canister. CHARLIE (CONT'D) (TO PETER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be a magician. As the face emerges, Charlie readies a match, then reache for his STAKE-- PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! No-- CHARLIE stops JUST AS HE'S ABOUT TO TOSS the match. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? IT'S ADAM, sleeping in a shallow dirt grave. Charlie reacts. Holy shit. He pushes his mask back. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam. I know him. Knew him. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. Don't wake him up, for CHRIST'S--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stops. He's looking over Charlie's shoulder, horrified. In the dirt behind CHARLIE are MORE GRAVES. Eight or ten least. Charlie turns. Sees the graves. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know them too? Charlie reacts, stunned. Peter moves to another grave, uncovers another sleeping f And then another. A hulking man, a suburban mom... Charlie uncovers another body. Stops, chilled. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Granada. My geometry teacher. (RUEFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was hard up.
PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we go back to my "run away" plan? CHARLIE (IGNORING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't burn Jerry out. There's no way we'll get all these people out if the house goes up. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you're here for Amy. (off Charlie's look) Great. Right. Save the Geometry-- A SCREAM stops him. Amy. Charlie and Peter spin -- it's coming from behind the door to the other room. A beat. They're both petrified as they move toward the door. Peter readies the gun again. Charlie pulls a CROSS out al with the stake. They creep toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Charlie puts his hand on the doorknob... Turns it... WHAMP! -- Charlie's VIOLENTLY SHOVED THROUGH THE DOOR int the STORAGE AREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hits the dirt hard. The door SLAMS SHUT AND LOCKS BEHIND HIM. He's in a small room with a LARGE DIRT GRAVE in the middle. Jerry's grave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's confronted by JERRY. Who smiles darkly. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look bigger on TV. Peter fires the shotgun, BLAM! But he misses Jerry and the power of the blast sends PETE HURTLING BACKWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie reacts to the blast -- but sees that ST. MICHAEL' STAKE has fallen from his hand and rolled to the edge of grave. He cautiously moves to retrieve it... He stops as he sees A FIGURE emerge from the dark. AMY. Her clothes are torn now, a thin trickle of blood runs do her neck. She looks impossibly sexy. Her hair, her eyes, her lips -- all shining and full. Forgetting himself, he goes to her. Pulls her into his ar CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, God... She clings to him, near tears. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter scrambles on the ground, SHOTGUN trained on JERRY - who moves toward him calmly. The cross on the gun the onl thing holding him back.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Peter fires again -- grazes JERRY. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In pain, he TRANSFORMS and VAMPS before our eyes with a b curdling yell. It's chilling.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVES
dialogues.text: One by one, the TRIBE of vampires wake. ADAM, MS. GRANADA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy pulls away from Charlie -- says: AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have run with me while we had the chance. You should have saved me, Charlie.
Charlie takes this in, pained. Then-- CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late. She brings her lips close to his ear. Rasps... AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. He's inside me now. Her EYES GO DARK -- fingernails grow SHARP and dig into Charlie. He feels the change. CHARLIE AMY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie shoves her off, hard. But she holds him tight -- they TUMBLE INTO THE GRAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JERRY, backed by ADAM, MS. GRANADA and a handful of other vampires, closes in on PETER. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, guy. Charlie -- his girl's having her way with him. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's way out of his league anyway. Peter, trapped, won't be able to keep them at bay much longer. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! Desperate, he BLASTS them again. Hits one on the shoulder But it's not stopping them. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your aim-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it! I'm on your side. Peter smiles a little. Shows his rows of SHARP FANGS. Jerry and the others stop. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Charlie struggle. He reaches for his cross -- but she throws him off her with a violent HISS. Charlie gets his first look at AMY in full VAMPIRE glory. She's even more freaky looking than Jerry or Ed. Her face nearly overtaken by a wide mouth filled with razor-sharp teeth. Her eyes are crazed and blood-red. It's gruesome and terrifying. Charlie sees THE STAKE at the lip of the hole. Dives for Amy's on him in a flash. She throws him to the ground. He got the STAKE in hand. Ready to strike. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me. She STRADDLES HIM, sexual and raw. Charlie's repulsed, terrified. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be the best you ever had. The only you had. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. We can be together forever. She leans in, licks his neck seductively... AND GASPS. She sits back, the STAKE IN HER CHEST. She falls away, shuddering. Charlie pulls the stake out -- scrambles out of the nest. He looks back at her, anguished. A beat. AMY, in terrible pain, LAUGHS. Nothing's happenin No kablooey. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed. You missed. Charlie BREAKS THE DOOR OPEN with his crowbar.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He backs away from her. Into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement where Jerry and the THE TRIBE are CIRCLED ar a body as MS. GRANADA feeds. ON PETER, who's pale and shaking... Charlie attacks them with THE CROWBAR. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off him! He hits MS. GRANADA off Peter. Manages to hold off JERRY a beat. Spins and HITS ADAM in the head. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. AMY enters from the other room -- already healing. Jerry sees her -- holds up a hand and backs the others off. JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll finish this. Jerry, all swagger, moves in on Charlie. Charlie sees Peter, barely alive, spit out his FAKE VAMP teeth. Peter meets his gaze, wry and weak. Done for. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth a shot. "Master of illusion." Now Charlie notices SHOTGUN not far from Peter's body. He dives for it, but Jerry steps on it -- kicks it away. JERRY (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's going to stop me? Time to man up. Jerry brutally kicks Charlie, sends him sprawling.
JERRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. I'm going to kill your girl -- make you watch. I'll take my time with you. And once you're dead, I'll finish your mother. (RE: AMY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad about that one. She sucked me dry. Like a pro. Amy smiles a little. Jerry GRABS CHARLIE, lifts him off h FEET--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, enraged, SPRAYS JERRY WITH GAS FROM the CANISTER right in the eyes. Jerry recoils, HISSING. Adam and the OTHER VAMPS MOVE IN. Jerry's over it. He's on CHARLIE in a flash, FANGS BARED. About to RIP HIS NECK OUT.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: PETER has the gun again -- has managed to pull himself up into a sitting position. He BLOWS away ONE OF THE SUPPORT BEAMS. BLAM! And ANOTHER. BLAM! And ANOTHER. BLAM -- he misses. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. BLAM! AND ANOTHER. Charlie DIVES for SAFETY as the CEILING COLLAPSES in part the basement. SUNLIGHT STREAMS in -- forcing JERRY, AMY a the other vamps into a corner. PETER (CONT'D) (TO JERRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah! Nice sweater, loser!

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Another BEAM collapses. BURYING JERRY, AMY and the others under DEBRIS from the floor above. A stunned beat. Peter slumps, exhausted from the effort.
Charlie looks at him -- amazed. PETER (CONT'D) (WEAK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm better with stationary targets. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you are. Peter looks at him, sad. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. We don't have much time before they dig out. CHARLIE (RE: STAKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can save you. I have to kill him with this. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a brave mother, I get it. And you were right. This is how I had to go... But we didn't count on an army. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill you both, he said-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're already dead. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go now, you live to fight another day. Stay -- there won't be one. Charlie stops. Swayed. Pained. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Accepting it. It's what he has to do. He starts DIGGING. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! But Charlie ignores him, determined. Pulls his MASK DOWN over his face again. PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

WHAM! JERRY BURSTS OUT OF THE RUBBLE, attacks Charlie. Charlie falls back, PULLING JERRY with him into THE LIGHT Jerry BURSTS INTO FLAME -- but holds Charlie tight AMY and the other vamps start to claw their way OUT of th rubble. Charlie and Jerry fight -- nearly ENGULFED IN FLAMES now PETER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! Peter gets up, painfully, moves to help. Raging and desperate -- Charlie and Jerry continue to bat Finally, Jerry pulls Charlie down with him --rolls on the ground as they fight. Trying to put out the flames. Jerry starts to DISINTEGRATE -- he's about to EXPLODE int bits. Charlie's stake is now ON FIRE. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: A last desperate attempt. He can see Jerry's HEART, about burn away. HE STAKES JERRY. AMY suddenly SCREAMS - she's burning inside, DYING. Or so seems. The vampire is being burned out of her. PETER cries out too, reacting less violently. But in pain JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still burning, looks down as the STAKE OF SAINT MICHAEL i his CHEST. Right through the heart. He starts to SHAKE VIOLENTLY -- faster and faster, just l Ed did -- becoming little more than a macabre BLUR. For a moment -- Jerry's human form hangs in the air... JERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow me. THEN HE BLOWS INTO A MILLION PIECES.
Thinking fast, PETER tackles CHARLIE -- who is still in flames. They tumble into one of the open graves. DIRT pours in around them, extinguishing the fire. ON AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transformed and healed. Herself again. She rushes to the edge of the open grave.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE OPEN GRAVE
dialogues.text: Peter pulls Charlie's mask back. Charlie is burned, unconscious. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! She crawls into the grave. Cradles Charlie in her arms. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie... Amy starts to cry. Peter looks on, concerned. Finally, Charlie opens his eyes. Says weakly... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow me? Seriously? Peter falls back -- exhausted. Laughing. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are his last words? What a tool. We pull away, leaving this tableau... UNTIL ADAM, MS. GRANADA and the OTHER MEMBERS of the trib emerge from the rubble. Disoriented, freaked. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MS. GRANADA
dialogues.text: Let's agree to never talk about this. FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, Amy, Jane and Peter are in Peter's penthouse. It a glittering night, a spectacular view.
Jane, released from the hospital, looks healthy and glowi She smiles at Peter, who also looks more together. She has a glass of wine -- he's drinking a COKE. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you'll ever feel the same about a nighttime sky? PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as what? I was always terrified. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. We're just catching up.

dialogues.speaker: ON AMY AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Charlie sees the connection between Peter and Jane. Shudders. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not seeing that. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deserves some fun. Your mom fully cheated death. CHARLIE (SUGGESTIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. You deserve fun. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I plan on it. Now that you've killed your first vampire... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so going to perform. Charlie KISSES her. It's intense, passionate. It's different, they're different. The childish part of them l gone. He runs his hands through her hair, pulls her close. SOMETHING BEEPS, talks... VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Frak!" "Frak!" AMY (PULLS BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, a little sheepish, shows her. He's wearing a BATTLESTAR GALACTICA wrist watch. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battlestar. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Ed's. Amy smiles a little, softens. AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frak? PETER is passing. Hears this. Is down with it. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frak! Right on. (TO AMY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect Woman, can I get you a drink? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take another. Thanks. CHARLIE (TO PETER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a hand. Charlie follows PETER into the DINING ROOM, where a BAR C is set up. Peter moves to it. Pours himself a Midori. CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were on the wagon. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. (off his look) I'm on the "day" wagon. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for inviting us. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should celebrate. Being alive. Your mom's clean bill of health. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to put the moves on her.     112 PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. What? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just -- I'm watching you. I've got to look out for her. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you do. So here's what I'm thinking. We faced the beast and we won. Can you imagine the possibilities if we had got that shit on film? CHARLIE VAMPIRES DON'T-- PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show up on film, yeah. But werewolves do, bigfoots do. We get proof, catch something -- we could build a stage act around that, you wouldn't believe. We'd blow those Cirque bitches away! CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An act? Seriously? What about saving people from evil? What ABOUT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHILLING LAUGH interrupts them. Distant. Eerie. And somehow familiar. Peter nods to his COLLECTION CABINETS. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens. All this stuff... CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever think about collecting something else? Snow globes or-- Charlie stops, catches sight of something MOVING IN THE REFLECTION ON THE FLOOR-TO-CEILING WINDOW. Just a wisp, a phantom. The face - is it ED? His features twisted in a grimace of fear and pain... It's CHILLING. Charlie's spooked. But he looks again and the face is gon CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, definitely get new stuff.
Peter leads CHARLIE OUT, back to the ladies in the other room. Still on about his idea...

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm serious, man. Do you know how much we could make? Think about how much people pay to see a tiger, or boobs, right? What if we had a tiger, boobs -- and a zombie! After they've gone we linger on the window. Is that Ed's eerie reflection again?, barely visible...

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're so coooool Brewster!! THE END
